name: Hard Clark Gable Movies Quiz / Test | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: Gable made a classic World War II Movie. Which one was it?
questions.explanation:
Command Decision.

	'Kwai' was Alec Guinness and William {Holden;} '30' was Spencer Tracy and Van Johnson. 'Day' was just about everyone.

questions.text: 'Mutiny on the Bounty' was one of Gable's best movies. Charles Laughton was brilliant as Captain Bligh to Gable's Fletcher Christian; who else co-starred in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Franchot Tone.

	Highlight of Tone's career, I suspect.

questions.text: Who co-starred with Gable in 'Red Dust'?
questions.explanation:
Jean Harlow.

	Lombard was his wife - but she wasn't in this movie. Kelly was in {'Mogambo';} 'Turner was in 'Honky Tonk'.

questions.text: Gable starred with Spencer Tracy in 'Boom Town'. What was the story about?
questions.explanation:
Oil.

	Good movie. With Claudette Colbert, too.

questions.text: Who sang 'You made me love you' to Gable?
questions.explanation:
Judy Garland.

	Classic movie moment, they say.

questions.text: Gable also made some westerns. Which one co-starred Jane Russell?
questions.explanation:
The Tall Men.

	Honky Tonk' featured Lana Turner. 'Queens' had several co-stars. Mogambo wasn't a western: it was an African safari (and Russell wasn't in it.)

questions.text: Gable's last picture was 'The Misfits'. Who wrote it?
questions.explanation:
Arthur Miller.

	With Marilyn Monroe, who was married to Miller at the time. Her last completed picture, too.

questions.text: Who was Gable's co-star in 'Call of the Wild'?
questions.explanation:
Loretta Young.

	He did many movies with Crawford - but this wasn't one of them. Gardner was in {'Mogambo';} Astor was in 'Red Dust'.

questions.text: In what movie does Gable give a lecture on the art of hitchhiking?
questions.explanation:
It Happened One Night.

	Cute bit.

questions.text: In 'San Francisco', what role does Gable play?
questions.explanation:
Saloon Owner.

	Spencer Tracy was the priest; Jeannette Macdonald was the singer.
